transcripts.speaker: Alice Kim
transcripts.text: Good morning everyone. Let's do our daily standup. I'll start. Yesterday I finished the authentication refactor and opened a PR. Today I'm going to work on the password reset flow.

transcripts.speaker: Bob Martinez
transcripts.text: Nice work Alice. Yesterday I was debugging that memory leak in the dashboard. Turns out it was the chart library not cleaning up properly. I've got a fix ready, just need to write tests. Today I'll finish that and start on the notification system.

transcripts.speaker: Charlie Davis
transcripts.text: I'm still working on the database migration scripts. Hit a blocker yesterday - the staging database credentials aren't working. Diana, can you help me get access? Should be quick.

transcripts.speaker: Diana Patel
transcripts.text: Sure Charlie, I'll send you the new credentials right after this call. On my end, I deployed the API rate limiting to production yesterday. Monitoring looks good so far. Today I'm reviewing PRs and then starting the caching layer design doc.

transcripts.speaker: Alice Kim
transcripts.text: Great progress everyone. One thing - we need to decide on the error handling strategy for the new APIs. Can we schedule a quick 30-minute sync tomorrow to discuss?

transcripts.speaker: Bob Martinez
transcripts.text: Tomorrow works for me. Maybe 2pm? Also, reminder that code freeze for the release is Friday, so let's make sure our PRs are in by Thursday EOD.

transcripts.speaker: Diana Patel
transcripts.text: 2pm works. And yes, I'll prioritize the PR reviews to unblock everyone before the freeze. Charlie, your migration scripts are top of my list.

transcripts.speaker: Charlie Davis
transcripts.text: Appreciate it Diana. I should have the full migration tested by Wednesday if I get those credentials today.

transcripts.speaker: Alice Kim
transcripts.text: Perfect. Alright, that's a wrap. Let's crush it today team!
